acme.title: Protocolo ACME
acme.noCertificatesDesc: Los certificados emitidos via ACME aparecerán aquí

acme.aboutAcmeDesc: ACME habilitars automated certificado issuance. Configure the server below, then use the directory URL with cualquier ACME client (certbot, acme.sh, etc.).
acme.aboutAcmeInfo: ACME (Automatic Certificado Gestión Environment) habilitars automated certificado issuance. Compatible with certbot, acme.sh, and otro ACME clients.
acme.letsEncryptProxyTip: Habilitar the LE Proxy to forward requests to Let's Encrypt while maintaining centralized audit logging and control.
acme.accountSecurityWarning: ACME cuentas contain private claves. Deactivate or eliminar unused cuentas to minimize seguridad exposure.
acme.agreeToTerms: Acepto los Términos de Servicio de ACME

acme.letsEncryptAboutDesc: Solicite certificados SSL/TLS gratuitos de Let's Encrypt. Los certificados son válidos por 90 días y pueden renovarse automáticamente.

acme.noClientOrdersDesc: Solicite su primer certificado Let's Encrypt para comenzar

acme.proxyUsageNote: UCM automatictodosy crears and cleans up DNS TXT records - no certbot DNS plugin needed!
acme.viewHistoryForCertificates: Issued certificados are displayed in the History tab.

crlOcsp.crlDescription: Certificado Revocation Lists (CRLs) contain serial numbers of revoked certificados. They are periodictodosy published and cached by clients for offline verification.
crlOcsp.ocspVsCRLDescription: OCSP provides real-tiempo revocation estado verificars. CRL is a periodic snapshot. Habilitar both for maximum compatibility with todos clients and applications.

settings.encryptionPasswordHelper: Use una contraseña fuerte - la necesitará para restaurar la copia de seguridad
settings.restoreWarning: Esto REEMPLAZARÁ TODOS los datos actuales con el contenido de la copia de seguridad. Esta acción no se puede deshacer.
settings.backupPassword: Contraseña de la copia de seguridad
settings.enterBackupPassword: Ingrese la contraseña usada para crear la copia de seguridad
settings.enableAuditLoggingDesc: Registrar todas las actividades del sistema

settings.useUcmCertificateDesc: Aplique un certificado existente de UCM como certificado HTTPS. Solo se muestran certificados válidos con claves privadas.

tools.subtitle: SSL verificarer, decoders, converters and clave matcher
tools.sslCheckerDesc: Verificar SSL certificado of a remote server
tools.converterDesc: Convertir entre PEM, DER, PKCS12, PKCS7
tools.keyMatcherDesc: Verificar if clave, certificado and CSR match
tools.supportsFormats: Supports: PEM, DER, CRT, CER, P12/PFX, P7B, CLAVE, CSR
tools.privateKeyFile: Private Clave File (opcional if included in input)
tools.pleaseProvideItem: Por favor proporcione al menos un elemento para coincidir
tools.pleaseUploadOrPaste: Please subir a file or paste content to convert
tools.privateKeyRequired: Private clave is requerido for PKCS12 conversión
tools.helpDescription: A collection of SSL/TLS herramientas to ayuda you troubleshoot, verificar, decode and convert certificados.
tools.helpSslChecker: Ingresar a hostnombre to verificar its SSL certificado. Shows válidoity, expiry, cipher suite, TLS versión, and cualquier issues like mismatched hostnombres or expirado certificados.
tools.helpCsrDecoder: Paste a CSR (Certificado Signing Request) in PEM formatoo to see its contents including subject, public clave tipo/tamaño, and cualquier requested extensions like SANs.
tools.helpCertDecoder: Paste a certificado in PEM formatoo to see todos dettodoses: subject, issuer, válidoity fechas, extensions, clave usage, fingerprints, and more.
tools.helpKeyMatcher: Verificar that a private clave, certificado, and/or CSR belong together by comparing their public claves. Useful before insttodosing certificados.
tools.helpConverter: Convert certificados and claves between formatoos: PEM ↔ DER, PEM → PKCS12 (requires clave), PEM → PKCS7. Descargar the converted file directly.

trustStore.addCertificatesForChain: Add certificates to validate certificate chains

trustStore.aboutTrustStoreDesc: The Trust Store contains certificates that are explicitly trusted for validating certificate chains. Add Root and Intermediate CAs here for chain verification.
trustStore.bestPracticesDesc: Only add certificates from trusted sources. Regularly review and remove expired or unnecessary certificates to maintain security.
trustStore.securityNoteDesc: Certificates in the Trust Store can validate any certificate chain. Be careful when adding third-party certificates.
trustStore.clientAuthDesc: De confianza para autenticación de cliente
